value.title: Create a Drill Through Button in Power BI Report
value.excerpt: In this vlog, we will learn about one of the most important feature rolled out in March 2020 Power BI Desktop update which is – Drill Through as an Action for Power BI Buttons.  Now, we can apply a drill through from a button’s click in Power BI. One latest action has been added to the button to Drill

value.title: Display selected value from slicer to Power BI Report
value.excerpt: Sometimes, there is a situation where we need to display the selected slicer value in the title of our Power BI visualization. Meaning, we need to set the Dynamic value for our Title column based on the slicer selection. How can we achieve this? How can we set dynamic title value for our Power BI visualization?

value.title: Forecasting in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we will learn how we can forecast our data in Power BI. We will be discussing which visualization supports forecasting in Power BI. value.title: Exploring the Visio visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Want to explore locations with data? The Visio visual in Power BI helps you do just that! Patrick looks at how to set it up and help use your data to highlight areas within a Visio diagram.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/visiosample  Documentation: https://support.microsoft.com/office/add-visio-visuals-to-power-bi-reports-4f09be62-f436-45c2-93b0-4a0f66b1f5a7

value.title: FAST - Billions of rows with Azure Data Explorer (ADX)

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Adam looks at 4 ways to get data in Power BI. This focuses on Power BI Desktop and the main storage modes - Import, DirectQuery and Live Connections to Analysis Services. If you are new to Power BI, be sure to check out this Power BI Tutorial: 4 ways to get data.   Import (Excel)
